ygData.subject: differentiation
ygData.msgSnippet: how do you differentiate between similar types of information with NEAT? I understand that the input should represent intensity, but what if I want to add more

Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

how do you differentiate between similar types of information with NEAT?
I understand that the input should represent intensity, but what if I
want to add more information? For instance: color. 
The only approach I see is to just tack on inputs that begin the same as
any other input. For a three color system, the eye just got three times
many more dimensions complicated. Is there any way to scale from a
monochromatic solution to a color solution, without forcing a new
search?

Chad 

------=_NextPart_000_12BC_01C43227.139B1360
Content-Type: text/html

<HTML>
<BODY>
how do you differentiate between similar types of information with NEAT?<br>
I understand that the input should represent intensity, but what if I want to add more information? For instance: color. <br>
The only approach I see is to just tack on inputs that begin the same as any other input. For a three color system, the eye just got three times many more dimensions complicated. Is there any way to scale from a monochromatic solution to a color solution, without forcing a new search?<br>
<br>
Chad
</BODY></HTML>
